body: Some traps include optional features that can make them considerably more deadly. The most common features are discussed below.
name: Miscellaneous Trap Features
url: pfsrd://Core Rulebook/Rules/Environment/Traps/Elements of a Trap/Miscellaneous Trap Features

sections.body: Mechanical traps might incorporate alchemical devices or other special substances or items, such as tanglefoot bags, alchemist's fire, thunderstones, and the like. Some such items mimic spell effects. If the item mimics a spell effect, it increases the CR as shown on Table: CR Modifiers for Mechanical Traps: CR Modifiers for Mechanical Traps.
sections.name: Alchemical Item
sections.url: pfsrd://Core Rulebook/Rules/Environment/Traps/Elements of a Trap/Miscellaneous Trap Features/Alchemical Item

sections.body: With a gas trap, the danger is in the inhaled poison it delivers. Traps employing gas usually have the never miss and onset delay features.
sections.name: Gas
sections.url: pfsrd://Core Rulebook/Rules/Environment/Traps/Elements of a Trap/Miscellaneous Trap Features/Gas

sections.body: Any trap that involves a danger of drowning is in this category. Traps employing liquid usually have the never miss and onset delay features.
sections.name: Liquid
sections.url: pfsrd://Core Rulebook/Rules/Environment/Traps/Elements of a Trap/Miscellaneous Trap Features/Liquid

sections.body: Traps with this feature can affect more than one character.
sections.name: Multiple Targets
sections.url: pfsrd://Core Rulebook/Rules/Environment/Traps/Elements of a Trap/Miscellaneous Trap Features/Multiple Targets

sections.body: When the entire dungeon wall moves to crush you, your quick reflexes won't help, since the wall can't possibly miss. A trap with this feature has neither an attack bonus nor a saving throw to avoid, but it does have an onset delay. Most traps involving liquid or gas are of the never miss variety.
sections.name: Never Miss
sections.url: pfsrd://Core Rulebook/Rules/Environment/Traps/Elements of a Trap/Miscellaneous Trap Features/Never Miss

sections.body: An onset delay is the amount of time between when the trap is sprung and when it deals damage. A never miss trap always has an onset delay.
sections.name: Onset Delay
sections.url: pfsrd://Core Rulebook/Rules/Environment/Traps/Elements of a Trap/Miscellaneous Trap Features/Onset Delay

sections.body: Traps that employ poison are deadlier than their nonpoisonous counterparts, so they have correspondingly higher CRs. To determine the CR modifier for a given poison, consult Table: CR Modifiers for Mechanical Traps. Only injury, contact, and inhaled poisons are suitable for traps; ingested types are not. Some traps simply deal the poison's damage. Others deal damage with ranged or melee attacks as well.
sections.name: Poison
sections.url: pfsrd://Core Rulebook/Rules/Environment/Traps/Elements of a Trap/Miscellaneous Trap Features/Poison

sections.body: Treat spikes at the bottom of a pit as daggers, each with a +10 attack bonus. The damage bonus for each spike is +1 per 10 feet of pit depth (to a maximum of +5). Each character who falls into the pit is attacked by 1d4 spikes. This damage is in addition to any damage from the fall itself, and the statistics presented above are merely the most common variant—some traps might have far more dangerous spikes at their bottom. Pit spikes add to the average damage of the trap (see Average Damage, below).
sections.name: Pit Spikes
sections.url: pfsrd://Core Rulebook/Rules/Environment/Traps/Elements of a Trap/Miscellaneous Trap Features/Pit Spikes

sections.body: If something other than spikes waits at the bottom of a pit, it's best to treat that as a separate trap (see Multiple Traps) with a location trigger that activates on any significant impact, such as a falling character.
sections.name: Pit Bottom
sections.url: pfsrd://Core Rulebook/Rules/Environment/Traps/Elements of a Trap/Miscellaneous Trap Features/Pit Bottom

sections.body: This feature applies to any trap that needs only a successful touch attack (melee or ranged) to hit.
sections.name: Touch Attack
sections.url: pfsrd://Core Rulebook/Rules/Environment/Traps/Elements of a Trap/Miscellaneous Trap Features/Touch Attack
